pageContext.claim: “There's been no nuclear testing at all for the last quite a long period of time, at least that we can detect. And the relationships have been very good [with North Korea].”
pageContext.analysis: North Korea may not be conducting nuclear tests, but it seems to be conducting the full panoply of provocative activities short of such testing. For example, it's testing missiles, rebuilt a rocket launch site this year, and has continued some work at its main nuclear facility at Yongbyon.
